column5: Sept 2 Indian shares closed higher on Friday  with the benchmark BSE index recording its biggest weekly gain in nine weeks  as strong August sales data of companies such as Hero MotoCorp and Tata Motors lifted investor sentiments.

column4: Indian shares edge up; Tata Motors  Hero MotoCorp gain
column5: Sept 2 Indian shares edged up on Friday  helped by gains in auto stocks such as Hero MotoCorp and Tata Motors on upbeat August sales data  while broader sentiment was subdued ahead of a key U.S. jobs report later in the day.

column4: UPDATE 1-Ackman's Pershing Square Holdings gains 5.8 percent in August
column5: BOSTON  Sept 1 Billionaire investor William Ackman's portfolios climbed nearly 6 percent in August  boosted by strong gains at drug company Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  where changes that the hedge fund manager has helped push for appear to be instilling new confidence.

column4: Hanwha Life Insurance considers Woori Bank stake
column5: SEOUL South Korea's Hanwha Life Insurance  said on Friday it is considering buying a stake in Woori Bank   adding that nothing has been decided.

column5: SEOUL  Sept 2 South Korea's Hanwha Life Insurance said on Friday it is considering buying a stake in Woori Bank  adding that nothing has been decided.

column4: Yum to sell stake in China business ahead of spinoff
column5: KFC and Pizza Hut owner Yum Brands Inc  said Chinese investment firm Primavera Capital and an affiliate of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  will buy a stake in Yum China for $460 million as Yum prepares to spin off the business.

column4: Yum's China unit gets $460 mln investment from Alibaba arm  Primavera - source
column5: HONG KONG  Sept 2 Yum Brands Inc's China unit has secured an investment worth about $460 million from an affiliate of Alibaba Group Holding and private equity firm Primavera Capital  a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.
